reviews.review_msg: I think Professor Chenier means well, but I struggled with how the course was (not) organized. The way items were marked with little feedback meant I had to meet with her several times and it left me wondering why she didn't raise her concerns with feedback as had I not done so, I could have made the same mistakes again. Would not take again.
Expectations unclear and same goes for her assignments. Was not open to any other ideas in class other than her own and made writing for difficult.
Judging by these previous posts, some people really need to grow up: Elise is a fantastic prof, extremely intelligent and interesting, and she cares about her students.
